instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.PM_EN_P3V3_G3H: What is PM_EN_P3V3_G3H? PM_EN_P3V3_G3H is a signal that enables the PP3V3_G3H rail to turn on. This comes out of ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip; when missing, often is missing because of a bad ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip. .
definitions.C6905: What is C6905? Capacitor to ground on charger input, if this shorts to ground the charger will not put out any power. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0.12A
threads.message:
Hello!,
Got liquid damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, that takes only 5v and 0.12A, looks like someone already tried to work on this board, because found out that cap <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR> had hole on pin1 - <SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL>. Would you think connecting <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR> pin 1 to <CAPACITOR>C6906</CAPACITOR> pin 1 would be ok in order to keep working on this board or hole already causing too many problems on this dataline?, 
Checked <DIODE>D6902</DIODE>  pin 3 on resistance mode - only 043.2 Î© 
<CHIP>U6903</CHIP> pin 10 (<SIGNAL>PM_EN_P3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>) - 0.7V only.
U700 had flux under it so looks like someone tried to replace it already.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 0.12A
threads.message:
You can test without <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR>.
Vut nust correct the wring resistance to ground first.
Remove <CAPACITOR>C6905</CAPACITOR>/06.
If still low, then remove <CHIP>U6903</CHIP> too.
If low value again, then you have problem inside board, between copper layers.
